description: Conversion of integral garages to habitable use to include alterations to front elevation and rear extension, and conversion of roof space to habitable use to include front and rear dormers with juliet balcony to rear.
decision_conditions: The proposed development would, by reason of its detailed design, scale, bulk and mass, appear as a semi-detached dwelling and an unacceptably incongruous and dominant feature which is visually intrusive in the wider streetscene and rear garden environment harmful to the character of the surrounding area contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

The proposed development would, by reason of its detailed design, bulk, depth and close proximity to neighbouring property be an intrusive and overbearing form of development, giving rise to an undue sense of enclosure, loss of outlook, loss of light and overlooking which would have a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent Mr M Shakil via email on the 18/1/21
